channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bins not being collected properly for months, 17th July
item.description:
Dear team, We continue to have issues with household waste removals - it's been sporadic for months. I've reported before, it was collected then and now it has been missed again. Reference number below if helpful. FixMyStreet ref: 7811164.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long grass, fire hazard, 17th July
item.description:
The grass in this area needs cutting in tha park and a long both sides of the railings. It is not only too ocer grown now but also is at real risk of catching on fire. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maitland Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of rubbish and dumped toys, 17th July
item.description:
This is all the way up the side of the verge absolutely disgusting the amount of rubbish along here. The grass is so long and there is just so much rubbish here. With a problem with rats and mice this needs to be addressed!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Smarden Drove, Elmstead, London

item.title: Huge volume of pungent materials from a Business, 17th July
item.description:
A new shop - Life of Fish has been consistently leaving its detritus from the shop outside where is it is a major nuisance. The smell of the wrappers and other materials causes a seriously offensive smell and destroys the serenity of the street and nearby businesses such as Fika 139 and Day next door. This has been an issue for a number of weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Bellenden Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 9 wheelie bins left blocking the road, 17th July
item.description:
Group of 9 wheelie bins - these bins used to be next to the fence on the pavement, now they have been moved into the road and have been there over a week. They block the road and are a hazard, accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Pelton Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Pelton Road, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Stean Street, does not maintain cleanliness in their front and back garden., 17th July
item.description:
Over the years this household has been using rotten waste in their front garden and potentially the back garden, as a result this attracts rodents and bugs to the area and the neighbouring area.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stean Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: When we have heavy downpours it floods the road rather than going down the drain - in winter it then freezes in the road causing a health hazard, 17th July
item.description:
Drain needs to be kept uncovered and free from grass and weeds growing around it so water can drain into this rather than flooding the road - a hazard in winter when the water freezes over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellhouse Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Morrisons car park wall knocked down on walk way leading to Nelson Road, 17th July
item.description:
Morrisons car park wall knocked down and remainder of wall is dangerous. There needs to be barriers installed to protect the wall and prevent vehicles slamming into it before someone is seriously hurt. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///pouch.enjoyable.common https://w3w.co/pouch.enjoyable.common

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jenner Close, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
